s.text: But Leonardo was not a genius the way Einstein or Galileo was.
As for Leonardo's "inventions," those that were sound from an engineering point of view were usually borrowed from contemporaries.
Little of Leonardo's weirdness is conveyed by the Codex Leicester exhibit--though Isabella Rosellini's blue-velveteen voice narrating the exhibit's eight-minute biographical video helps somewhat.
If there was a bit of Fuller in Leonardo, there was also a bit of Liberace in this theatrical, high-living dandy who favored brocade doublets and bad boys with pretty faces.
